content.description: Nice route mostly straight up the face, textured slab with no natural protection, bolted, not a good climb for heavy climbers, good for practicing delicate foot placements. Rated 5.5 in Adirondack Rock, it is not. At least 5.6+ and more like 5.8 with the developing layer of lichen and accumulated grit.
content.protection: Bolted but ....  an uncomfortable lead considering the smooth slab and the bolt spacing. Top anchors are hiding in the shade of some shrubs.
content.location: 4 ft to right of the large base anchor ring (can't miss it) ... look up and you should see 3 bolts.

content.description: The lower and easily seen slab, easily accessed from the "road". The routes are described in Adirondack Rock, locations are determined relative to a huge ring bolt above the ground on left hand side.      Partially cleaned making some routes climbable.
